channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned ASDA shopping trollies at end of Petts Wood Road by footbridge, BR5 1LA, 4th November
item.description:
Two abandoned ASDA shopping trollies at the end of Petts Wood Road by the railway footbridge, opposite 217 Petts Wood Road, BR5 1LA (Adams House Dental Practice). Not sure how they got there when the nearest ASDA is in Swanley! Please can they be removed - thank you. If they were from our local Morrisons, I would have returned them myself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 215-217, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree block street light, 4th November
item.description:
Unsafe. Tree with large spread, branches encroaching street lamp and blocking considerable amount of light emitted. Street and adjacent alleyway are in complete darkness. Visibility in immediate vicinity is very poor, rendering area unsafe for both pedestrians, road users and vulnerable individuals out at dusk or later.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Avenue, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of rubbish, 4th November
item.description:
A pile of rubbish next to 31 Borland Road first reported anonymously on 24 October including bin bags, garden hoses carpet and wood. Please remove this. It has been marked as “under investigation” since 24 October but has not yet been removed

item.title: Street light not working, 4th November
item.description:
Upon my dog walk tonight there is a street light not working behind 26 malthus path closest to the start of the alley also all street lights around birchmere feild are all out dog walkers are having to bring there own source of light just to walk there dogs and the lights are also out around the football cage / basket ball cage closest to birchmere can we have all the street lights back on to make our neighbour hood safe please Many thanks Kind regards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Byron Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant of dumping of rubbish from The Factory, 4th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nile Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle since early September, 4th November
item.description:
